articles.headline: Trump Sealed Carrier Deal With Mix of Threat and Incentive
articles.snippet: As critics decried incentives for Carrier in exchange for keeping workers in Indiana, and others called the effort a new path to economic growth, the company announced other cuts.
articles.abstract: As critics decried incentives for Carrier in exchange for keeping workers in Indiana, and others called the effort a new path to economic growth, the company announced other cuts.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — The long-promised call from Donald J. Trump to the heating and cooling giant Carrier came early one morning about a week after the election, when he unexpectedly won the industrial heartland.

articles.headline: Howard Schultz to Step Down as Starbucks Chief Next Year
articles.snippet: Mr. Schultz is planning to leave the job in April, turning the reins over to his handpicked successor, Kevin Johnson.
articles.abstract: Mr. Schultz is planning to leave the job in April, turning the reins over to his handpicked successor, Kevin Johnson.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Howard Schultz, the visionary leader of Starbucks, said on Thursday he would step down as chief executive next year, handing over to his personally selected successor the management of the company he built into the world’s largest coffee business, with over 25,000 stores in 75 countries.

articles.headline: James Mattis, Outspoken Retired Marine, Is Trump’s Choice as Defense Secretary
articles.snippet: The retired general once led the United States Central Command, but his tour was cut short by the Obama administration, which believed he was too hawkish on Iran.
articles.abstract: The retired general once led the United States Central Command, but his tour was cut short by the Obama administration, which believed he was too hawkish on Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Thursday he had chosen James N. Mattis, a hard-charging retired general who led a Marine division to Baghdad during the 2003 invasion of Iraq, to serve as his secretary of defense.
articles.byline: By Michael R. Gordon and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Trump’s Potential Conflicts Have a Precedent: Berlusconi’s Italy
articles.snippet: As prime minister, Silvio Berlusconi kept majority ownership in his businesses. Scandals ensued as those businesses profited and his fortune grew.
articles.abstract: As prime minister, Silvio Berlusconi kept majority ownership in his businesses. Scandals ensued as those businesses profited and his fortune grew.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump has said a wealthy real estate developer like him has never been elected president, so there’s no precedent for handling the many potential conflicts of interest that come with his dual roles.

articles.headline: Deluged Immigration Courts, Where Cases Stall for Years, Begin to Buckle
articles.snippet: With a backlog of more than 520,000 cases, many have become crippled by delays and bureaucratic breakdowns, creating a major obstacle for the president-elect’s deportation plans.
articles.abstract: With a backlog of more than 520,000 cases, many have become crippled by delays and bureaucratic breakdowns, creating a major obstacle for the president-elect’s deportation plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Va. — Walk into the immigration court here, and scenes of a justice system in collapse abound.

articles.headline: With Presidency in Play, Can France Embrace Economic Change?
articles.snippet: While the French economy has become more open and competitive in recent decades, candidates’ proposals to ease labor laws, shrink the government and confront unions face resistance.
articles.abstract: While the French economy has become more open and competitive in recent decades, candidates’ proposals to ease labor laws, shrink the government and confront unions face resistance.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — He compares himself to Margaret Thatcher, the British leader who set her country on a right-leaning economic course. A French newspaper splashed him on its cover with the Iron Lady’s hairdo and pearl earrings.

articles.headline: Trump Kicks Off ‘Thank You’ Tour, Reveling in Crowd and Campaign Themes
articles.snippet: The event resurrected signature applause lines and carried the hallmarks of Mr. Trump’s whiplash style during the election: indicting and promising, nostalgic and forward-looking.
articles.abstract: The event resurrected signature applause lines and carried the hallmarks of Mr. Trump’s whiplash style during the election: indicting and promising, nostalgic and forward-looking.
articles.lead_paragraph: CINCINNATI — He boasted about himself in the third person. He sneered at the opponents he had vanquished. He disparaged journalists and invited angry chants from the crowd, grinning broadly at calls of “lock her up” and “build the wall.” He ridiculed the government’s leaders as stupid and dishonest failures.
articles.byline: By Nick Corasaniti and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: With Populist Anger Rising, Italy May Be Next Domino to Fall
articles.snippet: Italy could be the next domino to fall as populist anger sweeps through Europe and the United States, upending the political establishment.
articles.abstract: Italy could be the next domino to fall as populist anger sweeps through Europe and the United States, upending the political establishment.
articles.lead_paragraph: TURIN, Italy — Italy’s prime minister, Matteo Renzi, only 41, once seemed to have solved the riddle of how to survive Europe’s populist, anti-establishment tempest. But with a critical national referendum on Sunday, the populist wave is now threatening to crush him and plunge Italy into a political crisis when the European Union is already reeling.

articles.headline: President Obama Is Handing a Strong Economy to His Successor
articles.snippet: Employers in the United States added 178,000 workers last month, while the unemployment rate dropped to its lowest level in more than nine years.
articles.abstract: Employers in the United States added 178,000 workers last month, while the unemployment rate dropped to its lowest level in more than nine years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Departing occupants of the White House rarely hand off an improving economy to a successor from the opposing party.

articles.headline: Who’s Taping Whom? Paranoia Infuses Brazil’s Scandal-Ridden Politics
articles.snippet: Much of the nervousness in the capital, Brasília, stems from a sweeping corruption investigation that, despite a change in administrations, has not gone away.
articles.abstract: Much of the nervousness in the capital, Brasília, stems from a sweeping corruption investigation that, despite a change in administrations, has not gone away.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Michel Temer, the fledgling president of Brazil, is furious.

articles.headline: Pageant Glamour for Those Who Have Reached the Age of Elegance
articles.snippet: The Ms. Senior America pageant, and others like it, celebrate women of a certain age — “between 60 and death,” one contestant joked.
articles.abstract: The Ms. Senior America pageant, and others like it, celebrate women of a certain age — “between 60 and death,” one contestant joked.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J. — LYDIA TANNE was being treated for cancer, but that wasn’t going to keep her away from the Superstar Theater, a 1,350-seat auditorium at the Resorts Casino Hotel here, the site a few weeks ago of the most recent Ms. Senior America Pageant.
